text:
He was trying to be clean. That morning, he washed very carefully. He got some soap from Nastasya and cleaned his hair, neck, and especially his hands. When he thought about whether to shave his stubbly chin or not, he angrily decided not to. “Let it stay as it is! What if they think I shaved on purpose? They would definitely think so! No way!”

The worst part was that he felt rough and dirty, like someone from a bar. Even if he had some qualities of a gentleman, what was there to be proud of? Everyone should be a gentleman and more. He remembered that he had done some little things that weren't exactly dishonest, but still... And he thought about how he compared to Avdotya Romanovna. He got frustrated and decided he would act dirty and rude, and he wouldn’t care. He would be even worse!

He was thinking like this when Zossimov, who had spent the night in Praskovya Pavlovna’s living room, came in. He was in a hurry to check on the sick person first. Razumihin told him that Raskolnikov was sleeping soundly. Zossimov said not to wake him and promised to come back around eleven. “If he is still at home,” he added. “Damn it all! If one can’t...”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov struggles with his self-image and societal expectations, feeling both ashamed and defiant about his appearance and behavior.
